content:
@Michael Lawley - I'm trying to import a CSV file (from https://www.labterm.dk/download/Index1 - more specifically https://www.labterm.dk/Download/DownloadTable/NPUdefinitionda211028.csv) and convert it to a code system using https://ontoserver.csiro.au/snapper/#/ - but I get an error. Would you know who I can reach out to, to have a look at it?
image.png

Hi @Jens Villadsen I had a quick look at that CSV file and discovered that it is > 28 000 lines long. Snapper is not designed to handle CodeSystems / resources this big; it is intended as a "simple authoring tool".
Additionally, it only understands TAB and COMMA separated files, while this appears to be a SEMICOLON separated file.

For cases like this, I would normally use Snapper to author the CodeSystem metadata then copy the resulting JSON and use it with a tool like jq to generate the CodeSystem.concept part.
@Michael Lawley - thx for getting back. I ended up authoring a tool that could do the conversion. But thanks for getting back
Jens Villadsen has marked this topic as resolved.
But it is tailorfit to NPU for now - but it can easily be converted to a multipurpose CSV/TAB/Semicolon-to-CodeSystem tool
I'll throw a link later today - hopefully ;) @Brian Postlethwaite
In essence its just a wrapping of http://opencsv.sourceforge.net/
